TextStrings:
Argh, those idiots! They really had to go and lose all of our cargo! Our fresh samples!
And on a mission to a planet with such annoying gravitational properties, no less!
Sigh. Getting these back won't be fun...
As I suspected, this won't be fun at all, unlike when we originally collected the samples.
Okay, I should focus on navigation, need to be careful when accelerating and slowing down...

All these narrow passages really test my patience! But also, hrm... I can't seem to see one of the samples with my own eye, even though the scanner says it's here?
I wonder where it went...
This area looks to be straightforward enough for a change. Not much to do here, just gotta grab the cargo. We don't want it to get loose again, after all.

Oh, what the helly? Is this were they lost the majority of the cargo?! Just how many capsules are there?! Well, at least it's a relatively open area, so I don't have to worry about the shields so much...
Still, I'm gonna bint their boat a new one when we're done with this... *grumble*

Hey, thanks for trying this demo build of "Bouncing UFO"! I know there isn't too much to it, but it *is* the first game (if you can call it that) that I started coding, that went anywhere near this far!
That said, if you do want to mess around in the game some more, I have unlocked the level select menu for you!
Anyway, that's about it! Thank you very much for playing, and I hope you enjoyed this demo at least a little bit! See you later!
